item.title: Ticket #323 (wp-mail.php broken?) created
item.dc:creator: anonymousbugger
item.description:
Upon posting via wp-mail.php on a vanilla WP 1.3-CVS of today, I get:

Fatal error: Call to undefined function: wp_insert_post() in /disks/ideraid1/web/saers.com/blog/wp-mail.php on line 145

item.description: Crappity crap, I forgot to set the category. Can someone switch that to whatever's appropriate? Probably "Template".

item.title: Ticket #322 (Need a template function to differentiate between static pages and ...) created
item.dc:creator: beoba
item.description: On my site, I wanted a function that I could stick in my template code to make static pages look different from dynamic posts. An example of where this would be useful would be to, in my case, hide the category and date, as they don't really make much sense for an "About" page. I looked around in wp-includes and didn't see anything, and nothing came up from a post to the forums, so I made one myself. Here it is:

item.title: Ticket #321 (Check for month or search in manage screen fails on systems with ...) created
item.dc:creator: christoph
item.description: In line 124 in wp-admin/edit.php the if-clause checks the passed parameters directly instead of using PHP's super global $_GET-array and therefore won't work on systems with register_globals turned off. Changing the if-condition to ( empty($_GETm?) && empty($_GETs?) ) should fix the bug.
